identificationModule.briefTitle: Effect of Dietary Phospholipids on Atopic Dermatitis
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effect of Dietary Milk Phospholipids on Subjects With Atopic Dermatitis

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The aim of the study is to investigate the influence of a milk phospholipid enriched dairy product on subjects with atopic dermatitis determining parameters of the immune status, the plasma lipid profile and the skin texture.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Based on the facts, that on the one hand milk phospholipids are characterized by a high sphingolipid content and on the other hand a disturbed sphingolipid metabolism in the epidermis of patients with atopic dermatitis was verified, a double blinded, controlled, randomized, cross-over study with a daily supplementation of 3 g milk phospholipids to subjects with a mild to moderate atopic dermatitis will be conducted.

Forty patients will be randomized between two groups of each 20 patients. After an individual checkup and a run-in period of 2 weeks, the one group will receive the phospholipid enriched dairy product and the second group will be given a placebo dairy product over two month. A wash out-period of 4 weeks will follow, and the patients will consume the contrary dairy products over two month after a 2-week run-in period again.

interventions.name: milk phospholipid
interventions.description: The patients will consume daily 250 mL of a dairy product, which is enriched with 3 g of milk phospholipids.

interventions.name: diary product
interventions.description: The patients will consume daily 250 mL of a common dairy product.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in skin texture from baseline and in comparison with placebo

secondaryOutcomes.description: total IgE, specific IgE, sE selectin, Interferon-gamma, Tumor necrosis factor-alpha, Interleukin 4, 12, 16, 31
Blood lipids (Total cholesterol, LDL cholesterol, HDL cholesterol, triacyl glycerdies, fatty acids, phospholipids)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* mild to moderate atopic dermatitis (SCORAD \< 30)
* age: 18 - 60 years

Exclusion Criteria:

* intolerance against milk proteins
* systemic medication with corticosteroids or antihistamines
* immune mediated disease
* atherosclerosis
* hyperlipidaemia
* diabetes mellitus
* angina pectoris
* adipositas
* pregnancy and breast feeding

overallOfficials.name: Gerhard Jahreis, Prof. Dr.
overallOfficials.affiliation: Friedrich Schiller Univesity of Jena, Department of Nutritional Physiology

references.citation: Keller S, Le HY, Rodiger C, Hipler UC, Kertscher R, Malarski A, Hunstock LM, Kiehntopf M, Kaatz M, Norgauer J, Jahreis G. Supplementation of a dairy drink enriched with milk phospholipids in patients with atopic dermatitis - a double-blind, placebo-controlled, randomized, cross-over study. Clin Nutr. 2014 Dec;33(6):1010-6. doi: 10.1016/j.clnu.2014.01.014. Epub 2014 Jan 29.

ancestors.term: Congenital, Hereditary, and Neonatal Diseases and Abnormalities
